{"step_by_step_thinking": "The curve passing through the buccal and lingual cusp tips of the mandibular buccal teeth is known as the Curve of Spee. This curve is named after the German dentist, Friedrich Wilhelm von Spee, who first described it. The Curve of Spee is a natural curve that exists in the occlusal plane of the mandible. It starts from the tip of the lower incisors and follows the buccal and lingual cusps of the posterior teeth, creating a smooth curve.", "answer_choice": "C"}
